text: Vlad would risk anything, even eternal servitude under an unjust tyrant, in order to bring back his beloved Isabella.
Before his latest untimely demise, Vlad Von Carstein's most prized goal was the very throne of the Empire of Man. Now, it's time to collect it once more.

Five hundred years ago, Vlad's reign of terror met an untimely hand due to the intervention of the previous Grand Theogonist. Though different in name and body, their role is shared - it's time to take out Volkmar the so-called Grim.
Arkhan will always serve Nagash, always.
He who formerly marched and killed and marched and killed some more under the blessings of Khorne. The ultimate undead warrior, right tool for the Master of Death.

Vampires may be all cursed with madness, but this one's mind dances a dance of its own. The quintessence of a wild card, but a powerful vampire and warlord all the same. With an easy reward to dangle.
Powerful, ambitious, extremely untrustworthy. Vashanesh's son in darkness will be useful nevertheless.
The first vampire, a lady of shadows, her entire coven back in the fold.
And who is this handsome devil?
Arkhan the Black's existence serves only one purpose: to uplift his dark master's ambitions.
Arkhan shall not suffer anyone to challenge the Great Necromancer, not even the king of Khemri.
Arkhan prides himself in being Nagash's most faithful servant, and knows his dedication will be well rewarded in time.
And with no doubt whatsoever, the most powerful, fairest, and truest. Certainly, last standing.
From atop her lair, the Queen of Mysteries oversees the intricate web of agents she has spun across the world.
Lahmia is Neferata's birth right, and it has been wrestled from her fair hands for too long. This shall not stand any longer.
What is the Definition of Madness?
What is the Definition of Madness?
What is the Definition of Madness?
Stout is old magical bronze, and vicious. \\n(Building can be found in risen Black Pyramid)
Mercenary, they call me. Well, my troops don't complain. \\n(Building can be found in risen Black Pyramid)
Old friends. Treacherous they may be, selfish, yes, but with the proper leverage...  \\n(Building can be found in risen Black Pyramid)
For all their pledges, Mortarchs may need unfailingly-loyal eyes watching over them...
And it is not just the Legion that which is doomed. \\n(Building can be found in Morgheim)
Undead troops hardly cheer when their leader is the first in the melee, but somehow it all counts. \\n(Building can be found in Morgheim)
An armoured gauntlet pointed at everything living, and unliving under the wrong banners. \\n(Building can be found in Morgheim)
Krell used to collect skulls for the throne of his previous master. Now he adds them to the armies of the Great Necromancer.
As cold and devoid of emotion as he is, Krell will still challenge the mightiest foes to prove his mettle.
The Black Axe rarely stays unstained with the scarlet of blood and gore. Its tally is numberless.
For all their pledges, Mortarchs may need unfailingly loyal eyes watching over them...
Questions? What Questions? \\n(Building can be found in Awakening)
So much to do, so many minds, so many directions. \\n(Building can be found in Awakening)
You may need special powers, and possibly an anchor and lengths of rope, to gather what Luthor can reliably do best, but you'll know it once you're there. \\n(Building can be found in Awakening)
The definition of madness is doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
The definition of madness is doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
The definition of madness is doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
The great admiral of the dead seas, captain of the Black Coffin, ocean-faring servant of the Great Necromancer. Still insane.
For all their pledges, Mortarchs may need unfailingly loyal eyes watching over them...
Travel far, travel fast, for knowledge and powerful items. \\n(Building can be found in Castle Drakenhof)
The true Von Carstein. \\n(Building can be found in Castle Drakenhof)
Rise, my puppets. \\n(Building can be found in Castle Drakenhof)
Sylvania has long been Mannfred's domain, and he will let nobody else take it from him. Not even his sire.
Mannfred Von Carstein's hubris is legendary. He sees himself as the greatest of his bloodline, and will stop at nothing to prove it.
Mannfred has sworn loyalty to the Great Necromancer - to what extent remains to be seen.
For all their pledges, Mortarchs may need unfailingly loyal eyes watching over them...
It comes under many names, Seat of the Lord of Undead, Final Destination, Hidden Fortress,  Nagash summer holiday resort.
There be monsters. And here comes their king.
Blood will flow through the streets. True Vampires will feast and sparkly ones will lie dead.
Even the seat of mighty Settra will bow to the power of Nagash.
In distant lands of pirates and zombies, lies a site of power worthy of his mightiness.
The ancient mansion of the von Carstein will contribute to end the world.
Primordial and misunderstood home of a Sorceress, fitting for a ritual.
A beginning to the end, an end to all beginnings. See the fate of all flesh and know despair!
Finally, the end of all petty squabbles, for death knows no jealousy, no conflict. Henceforth, only the peace of the great Nagash.
Mind you, there is no challenge in controlling a statue. \\n(Building can be found in Lahmia)
I'm a snake, you're a snake. Just like a spitting image. \\n(Building can be found in Lahmia)
The overly proud and the overly cunning, only one way the relationship can go. \\n(Building can be found in Lahmia)
Manipulation, and all the wrong kinds of motivation.
For all their pledges, Mortarchs may need unfailingly loyal eyes watching over them...
War is not won merely by standing behind thousands of skeletons. \\n(Building can be found in Castle Drakenhof)
Swiftly. Quickly. \\n(Building can be found in Castle Drakenhof)
The Von Carstein's dominion over certain fell creatures is undeniable. \\n(Building can be found in Castle Drakenhof)
The skilled vampire serves Nagash well, for all his great pride and perceivable doubt.
For all their pledges, Mortarchs may need unfailingly loyal eyes watching over them...
